page.title: 03NELSTROP'S FLOUR MILL
page.content:
The first Albion Mill in Heaton Norris was built in 1820 by William Nelstrop. In 1893 disaster struck. A great fire burnt the mill to ashes. A year later the present mill was built.
Nelstrops use wheat fron East Anglia, Manitoba wheat from Canada and Spring wheat fron USA.
The imported wheat is discharged from wheat tankers into large grain silos at Seaforth docks, Liverpool. It is then bought to Stockport in 20 tonne bulk wheat lorries. In a typical week 1600 tonnes is brought into the mill.
The different wheats are blended in varying proportions to provide 40 types of flour.The flour is sold to family bakers and supermarkets and exported to Nigeria,Egypt and Jordan.
